A peek inside the #VeraWang design room as we prepare for the unveiling of Vera\'s Spring 2017 Bridal Collection. Stay tuned for more exclusives.
#VeraWangBridal #VeraWangBride #weddingdress

Each piece of #VeraWangLOVE jewelry features our signature blue sapphire symbolizing everlasting love.
Sapphires have been used in engagement rings for centuries because they represent truth, commitment, loyalty, and everlasting love. The Romans were the first to use sapphire engagement rings to signal the honorable intentions of the groom. The tradition lives on today, as Princess Diana (who\'s ring now resides at the hand of her son, Princess William\'s bride, Kate Middleton), Princess Anne, and Elizabeth Taylor all received sapphire engagement rings, to name few.
See and shop the #VeraWang LOVE collection at #kayjewelers #jaredjewelers @zalesjewelers and zales.com

Dolce&Gabbana and Smeg have teamed up to design a special edition of the FAB28 refrigerator, transforming it into a work of art. The result of this partnership is the special Smeg refrigerator with unique Dolce&Gabbana styling. #DGSmeg

Dolce&Gabbana and Smeg belong to two different creative sectors but are united by strong values and a tradition of “Made in Italy" excellence. 100 exclusive refrigerators – the result of innovation and a meticulous eye for detail – are one-of-a-kind products that combine Smeg quality and technology and Dolce&Gabbana’s creativity and masterful artisan workmanship. The first examples of this special collection will be presented during the Salone Internazionale del Mobile 2016, which will be held from April 12 to 17 in Milan. #DGSMEG

Saw this... a rare post that grabbed my attention and made me STOP what a was doing... Had to share. #regram and thank you @sophiabush for posting.
This is @millastarfma and she\'s strong, beautiful, and inspiring! Milla is 9 years old, and just competed the Battlefrog Race. It\'s an obstacle course designed by a Navy Seal, and participants do a 36 MILE race, 8km swim, a full obstacle course, and oh yeah it\'s a 24 hour long event.
Milla decided to start training for races as a way to combat the bullying she suffered. To find strength within. She is an inspiration to young girls, women everywhere, and all of humanity. This is her mission statement:
My name is Milla Star Bizzotto, I\'m 9 years old.
I don\'t spend all day playing videogames.
I have a mission.
I obstacle course race with a purpose.
I DON\'T RUN THE KIDS COURSE!
I want to inspire a generation. #inspirationfortheipadgeneration I want to inspire kids to eat healthy and get outside and play.
I want kids to stand up to bullies.
I was bullied at school, kids get bullied all the time.
I no longer get bullied, now #iamtheantibully We are all made in different shapes and sizes, we need to love our bodies! #loveyourbody YOU ARE A FORCE @millastarfma!! Don\'t ever stop. You\'ve inspired me... And SO many! You are the definition of beauty! #girlpower

“For us, this project was much more architectural and residential than decorative and retail. I like to think that the space that we have created could actually serve as the interior of a modern house perched on a Mediterranean cliff.” Olivier Marty and Karl Fournier of #StudioKO, Architects. The House of #Balmain is very pleased to announce the opening of its Manhattan flagship located at 100 Wooster Street, NY.

“Olivier’s obviously done an amazing job in helping to introduce this historic house to America. This new flagship store will allow us to show a much more complete selection of Olivier’s designs for men, women and, soon, kids.” Emmanuel Diemoz, Balmain’s CEO. The House of #Balmain is very pleased to announce the opening of its Manhattan flagship located at 100 Wooster Street, NY.

“Anyone who knows me knows that I find America incredibly inspiring. I admire its uniquely open spirit, mix of peoples and impressive culture and New York is all that, multiplied by a thousand!” @olivier_rousteing The House of #Balmain is very pleased to announce the opening of its Manhattan flagship located at 100 Wooster Street, NY.

Joseph and Vanessa Friedman of @NYTimes sat down with @SpencerCBailey of @SURFACEMAG yesterday for Design Dialogues, discussing everything from how they got their start in the industry, to their take on the state speed of fashion today. JA, on sometimes taking a different, or outside perspective to fashion: \'What I really love about Vanessa\'s writing is that a lot of times, she is looking at something from the point of view of a larger societal or cultural moment...something as simple as a boot or a blouse and how is shown can be a reflection of the times we live... And I hope that sometimes I have the same approach (when designing.) Sometimes when my team and I start thinking about the collection, I\'m trying to think about the moment we live in and the cultural zeitgeist, what I\'m feeling and how I can express that in my collections...it\'s an important process for me to go through and to think about."

My Last Door, 1952/4, #GeorgiaOkeeffe "When I first saw the Abiquiu house it was a ruin with an adobe wall around the garden broken in a couple of places by falling trees. It was a good sized patio with a long wall with a door on one side. That wall with a door in it was something I had to have. It took me ten years to get it - three more years to fix the house so I could live in it - and after that the door with the wall was painted many times." Georgia (1976) #legendarylady #inspiration #NewMexico #Santafe #ART #madebywomen #everywoman

Youth and liberation in the new #GucciPreFall16 campaign. An indigo wool-cashmere patched coat, round acetate Havana eyewear (#AntonToftgard), rose printed georgette dress with pleated flounce details (@polypolina_o), striped beret and striped crew-neck, embroidered backpack and striped orange and black knit hat. 6/6 From the #GucciPreFall16 campaign, images that reveal the collection’s riot of colors, textures and movement. A wool mohair embroidered tuxedo with exotic loafers (Lucas Dambros @redbooyy), a Herbarium printed velvet jacket and flare pant, square frames with pale blue lenses and black fingerless gloves with pearls (polypolina_o). #GucciGarden
Photographer: @_glen_luchford Creative director: #AlessandroMichele Art director: @christophersimmonds

5/6 An aviary filled with eccentric curiosities in the #GucciPreFall16 campaign. A silk patched bomber, silk shirt, duchesse satin printed skirt and boots with tiger head spur hardware (@eva.minaeva). An embroidered cardigan, wool pajama pants, Cambridge shirt and beret (#FionnanByrnePerkins). Rose organza embroidered gown (@pavlovalia). An embroidered intarsia knit and patched jeans (#AntonToftgard). A wool jacquard knit and patched denim pant (@nicoleatieno). #GucciGarden
Photographer: @_glen_luchford Creative director: #AlessandroMichele Art director: @christophersimmonds

2/6 Presenting the #GucciPreFall16 campaign. Pink flamingos move freely across patterned rugs and among piles of old books. #GucciGarden Photographer: @_glen_luchford Creative director: #AlessandroMichele Art director: @christophersimmonds
3/6 A glimpse into the #GucciPreFall16 campaign featuring the new collection. Photographer: @_glen_luchford Creative director: #AlessandroMichele Art director: @christophersimmonds

4/6 Characters from the #GucciPreFall16 campaign. A trench, with a wool knit, check flare pants, Prince of Wales wool and cashmere scarf with Web border and GG motif suitcase (@elie.van.ravels). Chen Wei for #GucciGram Tian 中國攝影師陳維旨在透過他的作品創造美感和喚起社會意識。他的作品主要是靜物和風景，捕捉現代化背後的陰霾和愁緒，偶爾也會透出幾分歡樂氣息。過度生長的植物漫延至住宅之中，葉片佈滿整張床墊，而床墊上睡著一個頭部有如一個的士高球的人。他所塑造的畫面代表著我們在邁向未來的道路上無論走了多遠，依然會渴望返璞歸真，並承認自然的恆存。這個設計以完整的Tian圖案作為畫框，中間的照片所拍攝的畫面是懸掛於房間天

David Chan for #GucciGram Tian David Chan (@silentstudio) knows the power of juxtaposition. Throughout his playful, inventive work, seemingly unrelated elements are brought together in unexpected and revelatory combinations.

Tianzhuo Chen for #GucciGram Tian 陳天灼畢業於倫敦中央聖馬丁藝術學院，是在崎嶇的北京藝壇中脫穎而出的年輕藝術家。他從時裝界轉投至更刺激的藝術界，作品以揭示中國年輕人隱藏的醜陋一面為主題：毒品、性和名人。他將他於柏林知名夜店伯格罕參加過的一場表演的元素注入他的Gucci Tian圖案作品之中。服裝結合了京劇的視覺元素和風靡現代的嘻哈語言。誰會想到兩者竟會如此合襯？Tian圖案的鳥兒和猴子令畫面更為生動活潑，體現Gu

Gu Ye for ‪#‎GucciGram Tian 顾爷拥有深厚的策展艺术感。这位艺术家透过他极受欢迎的微博，把自己描写成来自艺术史的著名画家，如克林姆和梵谷。这些影像就像一种伪装，让这位东方艺术家可想象身为西方艺术家的滋味。他也会为他的关注者发布一些经典画作，如卡拉瓦乔和鲁索的作品。当艺术世界愈趋网络化之际，像顾爷这种艺术家将扮演重要角色。他们将使作品的美学设计变得全球化。在这里，他为Gucci Tian手袋塑造出一个传统的中国形像，完美融

Cao Fei for #GucciGram Tian 曹斐的作品與她的Instagram一樣多姿多彩，包括藝廊藝術裝置攝影、都市隨影，亦窺探了她在中國工作室的日常生活以及她遊歷世界各地的所見所聞。曹斐利用她的作品，包括影片、藝術裝置以及互動數碼媒體，剖析了自己的祖國在過去數十年的發展，並揭示了當中部分問題。她憑著作品「人民城寨」而一舉成名，那是她為網絡遊戲「第二人生」所創造的虛擬場景，也是現今中國的縮影。曹斐為全新的Gucci Tian拖鞋注

The Singaporean artist Charles Loh (@mossingarden) can transform a terrarium into its own universe. Like Bonsai planets, the artist’s sculptures, posted on his popular Instagram, are tiny landscapes created in glass chambers.

Cheng Ren for #GucciGram Tian 程然的多媒體藝術創作結合了風景、音樂和那份冰冷的城市疏離感，在全球化的時代中傳達一種青年文化體驗。在他的影片中，他或許以一群受驚的野鴿掠過天空，或以豐富色彩結合充滿互聯網術語的對話來拍攝未來景觀，表達了科技對自然界的影響。他的影片喻意了我們消費和使用媒體的方式，譬如用一個垂直iPhone式框架，但當中也包含了前衛元素：如燃燒的手袋、正在演奏的搖滾樂隊等。在他為Gucci所特別創作的作品
